Detailed Description

This class represents the classification stage of the OCR process, providing an interface to encapsulate different classification paradigms. Its task is to match every feature vector passed to its associated character. In the end of the process, a string of characters is available through the Classifier::characters() method.

See also:
ClassificationAlgorithm, ClassifierStatistics, FeatureVector, Dataset
Todo:
Implement new paradigms of classification (neural networks, support vector machines,...).
Author:
Eliezer Talón (elitalon@gmail.com)
Date:
2009-02-09

Member Function Documentation

const std::vector< std::string > & Classifier::characters (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Returns:
An array of std::string objects with the characters found, one character per feature vector passed in Classifier::classify() method.

virtual const std::vector<std::string>& Classifier::performClassification ( const std::vector< FeatureVector > &  featureVectors  )  [pure virtual]

Parameters:
featureVectors An array of feature vectors to classify.
Returns:
An array of std::string objects with the characters found, one character per vector element.
Postcondition:
The recognized characters become also available through the Classifier::characters() method.

Implemented in KnnClassifier.
